body_html:
@vrv This particular file has a lot of contribution from @keveman and @zheng-xq.

But this change is simple enough that it makes sense to me: it just ensures that whatever is already in PATH stays in PATH when cmd is invoked, which is necessary, e.g., if your gcc is not the system default. This is good practice in general.
body_text:
@vrv This particular file has a lot of contribution from @keveman and @zheng-xq.
But this change is simple enough that it makes sense to me: it just ensures that whatever is already in PATH stays in PATH when cmd is invoked, which is necessary, e.g., if your gcc is not the system default. This is good practice in general.
body:
@vrv This particular file has a lot of contribution from @keveman and @zheng-xq.

But this change is simple enough that it makes sense to me: it just ensures that whatever is already in `PATH` stays in `PATH` when `cmd` is invoked, which is necessary, e.g., if your `gcc` is not the system default. This is good practice in general.
